titles.title: Clean Air Sustainability Act of 2007

To amend the Clean Air Act to clarify certain provisions in the national emission standards for hazardous air pollutants to ensure that no major stationary sources of such air pollutants are exempted by Environmental Potection Agency rules from compliance with the maximum achievable control technology standard, and for other purposes.

bill.summary: 2/8/2007--Introduced. Clean Air Sustainability Act of 2007 - Amends the Clean Air Act to revise the definition of a "major source" of hazardous air pollutants to specify that a source's "potential to emit" refers to its maximum capacity to emit a pollutant on the date the source is required to comply with a national emission standard, without regard to any lower subsequent emission levels of that pollutant attributable to compliance with such standard or other factors.
